medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports a 6-month history of persistent non-bloody, non-mucous vomitus while eating or drinking and concomitant loose, watery brown diarrhea that occurs intermittently. She experienced sharp abdominal pain intermittently for 2 hours this morning, which has since resolved. Additionally, she has endorsed chills, rigors, and tactile fevers.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity, sleep apnea, seizure disorder, hypertension, deep vein thrombosis (DVT) status post 6 months of warfarin, chronic renal failure (baseline Cr 1.9-2.1), chronic urinary and stool incontinence.
